Message.Title: Out at about 38
Message.Msg: Bought at about 29 and have spent too much time in my life chasing that extra dollar only to wake up seeing a stock down 2-3 bucks the day after I was going to sell. Given overall yields elsewhere, this is still pretty good but I think I shall wait for a pullback and if it does not come so be it. GLTA longs.

Well, you bested me. Sold 1600 at $37.45 Monday only to take some money off the table. I still have a substantial number left and enjoy the dividend. It's been a great year. Saw a piece today that listed the dow componets by year to date stock price appreciation. T was number 4. T employees are turning in some great numbers.

I don't mind the hands off DRIP. $1,000 divvies I get every quarter are not enough yet to worry about a few dollars in share price swing. My accounts are with Etrade.

Topic.Title: Strong Up-Move After Weak Opening, T

Message.Msg: The market is weird. Every time one guy sells, another one buys, and they both think they're smart & that's how the market goes. You have to decide on which part you'll play! One thing is for sure that this journal helps me a lot to invest securely. I think it'll help you too.

This is the story of the blonde flying in a two-seater airplane with just the pilot. He has a heart attack and dies. She, frantic, calls out a May Day. "May Day! May Day! Help me! Help me! My pilot had a heart attack and is dead. And I don't know how to fly. Help me! Please help me!" She hears a voice over the radio saying: "This is Air Traffic Control and I have you loud and clear. I will talk you through this and get you back on the ground. I've had a lot of experience with this kind of problem. 'Now, just take a deep breath. Everything will be fine! Now give me your height and position." She says, "I'm 5'4" and I support Obama." "O.K." says the voice on the radio.... "Repeat after me: Our Father. . Who art in Heaven. . . .."

Message.Title: Free Internet For Your Ipod Touch
Message.Msg: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=SKWY4ZMjVwg

handlers? Do you mean where to roll your 401k over to? I use Etrade and have rolled over all my 401ks to my own IRAs in there. However, I have been on the same job the last three years and currently have $100,000 sitting in my current companie's 401k. When I leave this contract, which should be in the next few months, I will roll that money over also, but probably not to Etrade. I prefer to keep somewhat separate accounts. At the moment, I am considering Schwab or Scottrade. Schwab has some international features that appeal to me since I spend time overseas. Both got decent consumer review ratings. Since I do need a brick and mortar bank, I also have a Wells Fargo account. I may put the 401k roll over into there, just to establish a larger presence. They don't charge any maintenance fee if over $50,000. I don't like their trading and transaction fees. But, just to avoid having all my monies in one istitution, I have not dismissed Wells yet.
Freedom of speach
